main event: A civilian couple observed a blue-white light gaining altitude rapidly in the sky on April 6, 1949, using binoculars.
interesting points: The object was visible for about 15 minutes and appeared to be gaining altitude and making erratic movements., The couple initially thought the object might be an unconventional aircraft before it was identified as a weather balloon., The estimated altitude of the object was between 15,000 and 25,000 feet., The sighting was corroborated by weather balloon observations from multiple agencies at Stapleton Airport., The military conducted a thorough investigation and concluded the object was identified as a U.S. Weather Bureau balloon released earlier that evening.
sighted object: Blue-white light described as an elongated object
witness description: A civilian couple who were at Stapleton Airport observing the sky.
